rev.comment: /* Female genital mutilation */ add paragraph about controversy
/* Female circumcision */ sources incorrect or outdated, plagiarism
/* Female genital cutting */ plagiarism, removal of unproperly sourced data, rewrite of correct data.
/* Female genital mutilation */ plagiarism , sources not properly cited.
/* Health effects */ summarized 1989 study, but this is grossly out of date and new data will be added later.
/* Psychological consequences */ add amnesty international source
Undid revision 445961473 by [[Special:Contributions/Jakew|Jakew]] ([[User talk:Jakew|talk]]) rv It is sourced but it misquotes and misrepresents the study. Utterly misleading. Needs to be rewritten.
/* Sexual effects */ For the moment I am deleting this section, which contains only grossly misleading material. Needs total rewrite. Please see talk.
rv to restore properly cited content
/* Psychological consequences */ Deleting material which needs to be rewritten. It misrepresents Abusharaf herself and is grossly biassed. See talk
/* Sexual effects */ No need to discuss the sexual capabilities of women who are not genitally mutilated.
/* See also */ these do not relate to FGM they are only types of mutilation
/* Laws and prevalence */ moved to better section
/* Procedures: World Health Organization categorization */ shorteneded
/* Reasons for female genital mutilation */ shortened
/* Cultural and religious aspects */ changed link to article per article name
rv. please don't modify direct quotes

Undid revision 443052503 by [[Special:Contributions/Brainthinker|Brainthinker]] ([[User talk:Brainthinker|talk]]) FGM is prevalent in Iraq, it is not restricted to northern region, see discussion for source.

This was discussed before & explained that it's predominantly (not exclusively) practiced in NE Africa (not just East Africa or Africa as a whole), parts of the Near East (not the Middle East as a whole), and SE Asia (not South Asia as a whole).
there are new research which show that FGM is more widespread than sooner expected, to rely on the old believing that FGM is only practiced in east africa is simply wrong
remove template of an unprotected page

As explained before, it's predominantly practiced in Northeast Africa (it's likely place of origin; not Africa as a whole), parts of the Near East (not the Middle East as a whole), and Southeast Asia (not South Asia as a whole).

/* Procedures: World Health Organization categorization */ removed term "uncircumsized" from WHO Diagram 1, the diagram refers to non-FGM anatamy as "normal", plus even within circles that use the circumscion term it doesn't refer to all 4 types
/* Laws and prevalence */ changed a couple of "cutting" terms to FGM
/* Varying terminology */ removed phrase " All terms are currently still actively used.", self evident by content of section + past tense implies some fell out of use
changed acronyms as per name change
moved [[Female genital cutting]] to [[Female genital mutilation]]: per move request; see talk page
/* Laws and prevalence */ changed "near east" to "middle east"
/* Near â Middle East */ added Qatar

moved [[Female genital cutting]] to [[Female Genital Mutiliation]]: This is the term used by UN, WHO, universities, human right groups, etc. To argue that FGC is more neutral is Euphemism.
moved [[Female Genital Mutiliation]] to [[Female genital cutting]] over redirect: Reverting to what the talk page indicates is the more neutral term; new title is misspelt and uses improper case.
changed opener as per title change

moved [[Female genital cutting]] to [[Female Genital Mutiliation]]: This may be a polarized issue, but most Wikipedia name request changes are. Female Genital Mutilation is by far the most commonly used term in Academic, Legal, Medical, and News circ...

/* Laws and prevalence */ As much as I despise FACT tags, THAT claim needs a cite.
